Application.Controller

Class LoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application.Controller.LoginController

  • @Controller
public class LoginController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for managing the login of the User(s) of the platform.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Corti Lorenzo, Tocchetti Andrea

    • Method Detail

      • getLogin

        @RequestMapping(value="/login",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String getLogin(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Returns the empty credentials to be filled by the User to login.
        Parameters:
        model - Spring Model object.
        Returns:
        "login" string indicating the name of the Thymeleaf template to parse and return to the client.

      • doLogin

        @RequestMapping(value="/login",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String doLogin(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                                             @ModelAttribute(value="newUser")
                                                                                             Credentials credentials,
                                                                                             org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
        Perform the login for either a User or an Administrator.
        Parameters:
        model - Spring Model object.
        response - Instance of HttpServletRequest.
        credentials - The credentials provided by the User.
        bindingResult - Instance of BindingResult.
        Returns:
        "redirect:/scenario" or "redirect:/scenario-panel" string indicating the name of the Thymeleaf template to parse and return to the client, depending on whether a User or an Administrator logged in.
